timeline.headline: Evolution of DevOps
timeline.text: A timeline showing the key milestones in DevOps history

date.headline: The Term 'DevOps' Emerges
date.text: The concept of DevOps began to form as IT operations and software development communities raised concerns about the traditional software development model.

date.headline: Agile Infrastructure and Operations
date.text: Patrick Debois and Andrew Shafer discuss 'Agile Infrastructure' at the Agile Conference, laying groundwork for DevOps.

date.headline: First DevOpsDays Conference
date.text: Patrick Debois organizes the first DevOpsDays conference in Ghent, Belgium, officially coining the term 'DevOps'.

date.headline: Continuous Delivery Book Published
date.text: Jez Humble and David Farley publish 'Continuous Delivery', a foundational text for DevOps practices.

date.headline: Infrastructure as Code Gains Popularity
date.text: Tools like Chef and Puppet gain widespread adoption, enabling infrastructure automation.

date.headline: Docker Revolutionizes Containerization
date.text: Docker is released, making containers accessible and revolutionizing how applications are packaged and deployed.

date.headline: Microservices Architecture
date.text: Microservices architecture becomes mainstream, complementing DevOps practices with more modular application design.

date.headline: Kubernetes Released
date.text: Google releases Kubernetes, which becomes the standard for container orchestration.

date.headline: DevSecOps Emerges
date.text: Security becomes integrated into the DevOps pipeline, giving rise to DevSecOps.

date.headline: Cloud-Native Applications
date.text: The Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) gains prominence, promoting cloud-native technologies.

date.headline: GitOps Methodology
date.text: GitOps emerges as a practice using Git as the single source of truth for declarative infrastructure and applications.

date.headline: AIOps Gains Traction
date.text: Artificial Intelligence for IT Operations (AIOps) begins to be integrated into DevOps practices.

date.headline: Remote DevOps Collaboration
date.text: COVID-19 pandemic accelerates remote collaboration tools and practices for DevOps teams.

date.headline: Platform Engineering
date.text: Platform engineering emerges as a discipline focused on building self-service capabilities for developers.

date.headline: DevOps for Sustainability
date.text: Green DevOps practices gain attention, focusing on sustainable and efficient resource usage.

date.headline: AI-Enhanced DevOps
date.text: Generative AI and machine learning become integrated into DevOps workflows for code generation, testing, and operations.
